page.title: 03STAPLETON CHURCH.
page.content: The first record of the church is in 1291,and it acquired burial rights in the churchyard from the{Pope}in 1399.In the year 1785 a{"Brief"}was issued to raise Â£1,300 for the restoration of the church but it doesn't mean all the money was raised.In the church today there stands a notice recording rather quaintly that the church was "repaired and new pewed"in the rectorship of the Rev.Edward Powys a relative of the Lord of the Manor.The Churchwardens are named and also the "Overseers",one of whom bore the famous{Stapleton family name of Oakley.The Rev.CWA Fielding provided in the Vestry Book started in 1866.Not only did he supervise the work done under the direction of the London architect,Mr. Carpenter but he and his Powys relations contributed more than Â£1,000
